document.title: School Curriculum and Standards Authority (Western Australia)

jurisdiction.title: School Curriculum and Standards Authority (Western Australia)

302F4F43807E4BE8BB2AEDB919C0ACC3.description: Construct texts using software including word processing programs

226AF94319614EDD8EBA5E803B9B2285.description: Produce some lower case and upper case letters using learned letter formations

764AF8D8748A44C1963796A6C1C9D441.description: Participate in shared editing of students' own texts for meaning, spelling, capital letters and full stops

2F8787BA44564B63A0AF8956BB22B71D.description: Create short texts to explore, record and report ideas and events using familiar words and beginning writing knowledge

E767263839C44E82AA848F0C3D426F67.description: Use comprehension strategies to understand and discuss texts listened to, viewed or read independently

4482310E92BC4B13B182E00B2AC17007.description: Read decodable and predictable texts, practising phrasing and fluency, and monitor meaning using concepts about print and emerging contextual, semantic, grammatical and phonic knowledge

2CBE65CF61F34C5FA052A942BE4D7CD1.description: Identify some differences between imaginative and informative texts

178220820EBC4A7880D193AF7E4DD24C.description: Deliver short oral presentations to peers

9E50746A060949C99D7B7FE40F8D9B0F.description: Use interaction skills including listening while others speak, using appropriate voice levels, articulation and body language, gestures and eye contact

C7BE82508B3843DE90D43B47186A5598.description: Listen to and respond orally to texts and to the communication of others in informal and structured classroom situations

F82F00B085E04BD09772C9FE51131F73.description: Identify some familiar texts and the contexts in which they are used
